title: Naqshbandi
summary: The Naqshbandi (Persian: نقشبندی‎), also known as Naqshbandiyah (Arabic: نقشبندية‎, romanized: Naqshbandīyah), Neqshebendi (Kurdish: نه‌قشه‌به‌ندی‎), and Nakşibendi (in Turkish)  is a major Sunni order of Sufism. Its name is derived from Baha-ud-Din Naqshband Bukhari. Naqshbandi masters trace their lineage to the Islamic prophet Muhammad and Abu Bakr, the first Caliph of Sunni Islam.[2][3][4]
